metadata.description:
# Text Input Modal Component

A customizable modal component for entering key-value pairs, commonly used for form input.

## Example

```jsx
import TextModalInput from 'your-text-modal-input-library';

State.init({
  hidden: true,
});

const handleOnConfirm = (key, value) => {
  console.log("Key: " + key);
  console.log("Value: " + value);
  State.update({ hidden: !hidden });
};

return (
  <TextModalInput
    keyLabel="Your Key Label"
    keyPlaceholder="Your Key Placeholder"
    valueLabel="Your Value Label"
    valuePlaceholder="Your Value Placeholder"
    title="Your Title"
    confirmText="Your Confirm Text"
    hidden={hidden}
    onClose={() => State.update({ hidden: !hidden })}
    onConfirm={handleOnConfirm}
  />
);
```


Props
keyLabel

Type: string
Default: "Key"
Description: The label for the key input field.
keyPlaceholder

Type: string
Default: "Key"
Description: The placeholder text for the key input field.
valueLabel

Type: string
Default: "Value"
Description: The label for the value input field.
valuePlaceholder

Type: string
Default: "Value"
Description: The placeholder text for the value input field.
title

Type: string
Default: "Add Attribute"
Description: The title of the modal.
confirmText

Type: string
Default: "Save"
Description: The text for the confirmation button.
hidden

Type: boolean
Default: true
Description: Controls whether the modal is hidden or visible.
onClose

Type: function
Description: A callback function to be called when the modal is closed.
onConfirm

Type: function
Description: A callback function to be called when the confirmation button is clicked. It receives the key and value entered by the user as arguments.
...otherProps

Description: All other props not listed above will be forwarded to the underlying input elements.
HTML Attributes
All other props not listed above will be forwarded to the input elements within the modal, such as type, value, and placeholder. You can use these to further customize the input fields as needed.
